questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: What type of weather front would be responsible for the following weather forecast? Light rain and cold today with temperatures just above freezing. Southeasterly winds shifting to westerly tonight. Turning colder with rain becoming mixed with snow

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: What type of weather front would be responsible for the following weather forecast? Cool today with rain becoming heavy by this afternoon. Slightly warmer tomorrow. Winds southeasterly becoming westerly to northwesterly by tomorrow moring.

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.answer: D) has cold air rising above warmer air

mcq.option: A) has cold surface air ahead of it
B) has warm surface air behind it
C) has cold surface air behind it
D) has cold air rising above warmer air

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: Which below is not correct concerning an occluded front?
questions.answer: D) at the surface it is always followed by colder air

mcq.option: A) it is often associated with a broad band of precipitation
B) it marks a zone of shifting wind
C) it is colored purple on a surface weather map
D) at the surface it is always followed by colder air

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: Why do some mid-latitude cyclones quickly 'die out' after they become occluded?
questions.answer: The divergence aloft which removes air over the cyclone follows the place where temeprature contrast at the surface is greatest. Afterr the storm occludes the location of greatest temperature contrast shifts away from the center of the cyclone.

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: What type of weather front would be responsible for the following weather forecast: Increasing high cloudiness and cold this morning. Clouds increasing and lowering this afternoon with a chance of snow or rain tonight. Precipitation ending tomorrow m

questions.title: Question 7 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: On a weather map where cold air is replacing cool air what type of front is drawn?

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.answer: A) a cold front overtakes a warm front

mcq.option: A) a cold front overtakes a warm front
B) a warm front overtakes a cold front
C) a cold front overtakes a squall line
D) overrunning occurs along a warm front

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: What type of weather front would be responsible for the following weather forecast: Increasing cloudiness and warm today with the possibility of showers by this evening. Turning much colder tonight. Winds southwesterly becoming gusty and shifting to

questions.title: Question 10 for Class CLIMATE102_191021
questions.main: Explain why barometric pressure usually falls with the approach of a cold front or occluded front.
questions.answer: A cold front is a trough of low pressure.
